main.name: David Naimi
main.description: As a seasoned senior software engineer, I thrive in collaborative environments while also relishing individual challenges. With a passion for web development, I take pride in owning and shaping my career path, specializing in front-end and back-end technologies.
main.bio: As a seasoned senior software engineer, I thrive in collaborative environments while also relishing individual challenges. With a passion for web development, I take pride in owning and shaping my career path, specializing in front-end and back-end technologies.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Course Work: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Java, jQuery, Bootstrap, Express.js, React.js, Node.js, Database Theory, MongoDB, MySQL, Command Line, Git, and more.

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts - Business Administration, Marketing
education.description: Part of the Marketing Club and Ping Pong Club

work.title: Senior Software Engineer
work.description: Method is a team of product strategists, UX designers, and software engineers that create innovative experiences to improve lives and transform businesses. As one of the lead engineers, I played a pivotal role in architecting the application, utilizing MUI design systems in conjunction with Tailwind CSS to craft reusable custom components that enhanced the app's functionality and aesthetics. I developed a comprehensive check-in page for a tire company using React, Next.JS, employing the useReducer and context APIs for state management. The page seamlessly integrates features for customer check-in, tire ordering, and service scheduling like oil changes and tire rotations. Leveraging APIs for address retrieval, users can quickly input their address, facilitating fast customer creation or retrieval. This streamlined process ensures efficient service delivery while also handling vehicle registration, inspection, and accurate tire cost estimation.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Collaborated and implemented best practices for UI/UX design. Maintained and updated Manager UI, Accounts UI, Design System, Next.JS Website. Built a Dashboard where Authors, Marketers, Implementors, and Developers can increase productivity, check out visual graphs, and accelerators to navigate the CMS. Built out Duo Mode a new split screen experience for content authors to preview changes made to a page or headless endpoint directly in the app. Helped Improved and maintained Frontend Cypress, Sentry Infrastructure. Helped rebuild our company's Marketing Website with Next.js. Currently integrating Material UI into our Design System.

work.title: Associate Instructor
work.description: Currently supporting an intensive Fullstack Bootcamp at University of California San Diego involving 250+ hours of in-class teaching through an extensive curriculum using HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, jQuery, Git, GitHub, Heroku, Node, Express, React, MongoDB, MySQL

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: Works collaboratively with Design, QA, SEO, Implementation and Project Managers in creating custom Multi-family websites. Languages used:  Foundation Zurb, Ruby, HTML/HAML, Javascript, jQuery, CSS/SASS, Scroll Magic, Slick Slider, GIT, JIRA, Microsoft Teams, Gulp

testimonials.text: Patient, communicative, respected and good character all come to mind when I think of David. It has been an absolute pleasure working with David directly as both a student and instructional assistant over the past year. David excelled as a student in our part-time web development bootcamp program and transitioned into a reliable, knowledgeable and respected TA for our students in our full-time web development program. I feel very lucky to have witnessed and been apart of David's evolution from a student learner to teacher. David exudes confidence and is always willing to go the extra mile for the greater good. David is simply one of the good ones and he made managing him a breeze. I look forward to finding additional ways for us to continue to work together in the future.

I had the pleasure to work with David on our app. We had to refactor some features and get our app ready for the App Store Submission. David has been able to quickly master a complex pipeline and to refactor large portions of code He is a self-starter, a hard worker and a leader. Anyone would be lucky to have him on their team!
